Feline Domicile

Permanent Collection & Olfactory Archive

An environment is not a static container. It is a dialogue. A persistent, molecular conversation with its occupants. Here, at the Domicile, we are not merely housing subjects; we are curating consciousness through a controlled, bespoke atmospheric medium. The following are observational logs from the current cycle.

Alistair Finch, Curator.

Specimen Observations

#734B (Canis Lupus Familiaris)

The mail slot clicks loud,
His tail thumps a nervous beat,
Still no letter came.

#109F (Felis Catus)

Sunbeam finds the floor,
She naps in its golden warmth,
Ignoring my calls.

#822C (Corvus Brachyrhynchos)

A stolen bottlecap,
The price of a rival's glare,
Wealth is so heavy.

#55A0 (Mustela Furo)

Long body, short thoughts,
He dreams of a missing sock,
A soft, hollow tube.

The Atmosphere

The primary intervention is olfactory. A base of petrichor and Madagascar vanilla is rendered dynamic by a 24-hour cycle of neuro-active terpenes. Mornings begin with Pinene for alertness, transitioning to a lunchtime Linalool infusion to soothe digestive tracts. The evening concludes with a heavy, dream-like dose of Myrcene.

Note: Cycle 4.17 introduced a trace element of synthetic civetone, correlated with a 14% increase in paradoxical sleep among avian tenants. The ethical review is pending, but the data is promising. The smell is... sublime.

The Proprietor

All operations are overseen by our founder and landlord, Bartholomew. A Persian of immaculate lineage, his vision guides every aspect of the Domicile. He does not manage; he presides. His contentment is the metric by which all success is measured. He finds the current atmospheric blend "adequate."

Tenancy & Viewing

The Permanent Collection is at capacity. Applications are closed indefinitely. We are not accepting new specimens at this time.

Broadcasts from the Domicile are available only on encrypted channels, accessible to pre-vetted institutional partners. Unsolicited requests for access will be logged and ignored.
